sequences.name: United States Enterprise SaaS - Product Leaders Outreach Sequence
sequences.persona_name: United States Enterprise SaaS - Product Leaders
sequences.objective: Book an exploratory conversation to reduce cross-functional release delays and PM status reconciliation overhead

touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, congrats on {{company}}'s recent product push — noticed multiple public releases this year. Many enterprise product orgs struggle to coordinate cross-functional releases (engineering, QA, docs), leading to missed launch dates and scope creep. Asana centralizes release plans and dependency tracking so teams reduce cross-functional release delays by ~40% and PMs reclaim ~5+ hours/week. Would you be open to a 15-minute overview of how that could look for your teams?
touches.hints: Reference a recent public product launch or release note; mention number of product lines if known

touches.objective: Share a product roadmap dependency case study
touches.subject_line: How a peer mapped dependencies & cut scope creep
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, wanted to share a short customer note — an enterprise SaaS PMO we work with mapped feature dependencies in Asana and reduced unplanned scope creep by 30%. Happy to send the one-pager if useful.
touches.hints: Mention a comparable enterprise SaaS company or number of PMs supported

touches.objective: Deep dive on freeing PM time and consolidating status
touches.subject_line: Free 5+ hours/week per PM by cutting status work
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, I saw your team uses multiple spreadsheets and Slack threads for release status — that pattern commonly costs PMs 5+ hours/week reconciling updates. Asana consolidates status, automates updates, and surfaces technical debt on a single roadmap so PMs can focus on prioritization. I can send a brief playbook showing how we implemented this for a 200+ PM org. Want it?
touches.hints: If you know a PMO head or size of product org, call that out to increase relevance

touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, following up on helping reduce release delays and PM status overhead — would 20 minutes next week work to review how centralized release planning and dependency mapping could fit your roadmap cadence?
touches.hints: Call during local business hours; reference prior email and LinkedIn note

touches.objective: Provide social proof and final nudge
touches.subject_line: Roadmap playbook we used with enterprise PMOs
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, sharing a two-page playbook we used to standardize release cadence and surface technical debt for enterprise PMOs — it shortened escalation cycles and improved on-time launches. If useful I can DM the PDF.
touches.hints: Offer the playbook as a direct share and mention any mutual connections if present

sequences.name: United Kingdom Mid-Market Marketing - Campaign Leads Outreach Sequence
sequences.persona_name: United Kingdom Mid-Market Marketing - Campaign Leads
sequences.objective: Get a conversation about shortening campaign approval cycles and reducing asset rework

touches.objective: Introduce campaign coordination and approval bottleneck
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, noticed {{company}} manages multiple agency-style campaigns for clients — many UK mid-market campaign leads juggle manual task lists and slow client approvals, delaying launches. Asana centralizes campaign tasks, automates approval flows and version tracking, cutting approval cycles up to 50% and reducing launch delays. Would a quick 15-minute chat to see if this maps to your process be useful?
touches.hints: Reference number of active client campaigns or a recent campaign if public

touches.objective: Share agency case study on approval automation
touches.subject_line: How an agency cut launch delays 35%
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, quick share — a UK agency we work with used Asana + Drive integration to centralize assets and cut campaign launch delays by 35% through automated approvals. Can I send the one-pager?
touches.hints: Name a UK agency peer if appropriate or reference campaign types (PPC, Social)

touches.objective: Deep dive on asset version control and integrations
touches.subject_line: Stop rework — centralize Figma + Drive for creatives
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, creative teams often waste hours searching files and reworking assets due to poor version control. Asana’s Figma and Drive integrations centralize assets and version history, reducing rework and speeding approvals. I have a short case note showing 20% fewer revision cycles—want me to send it?
touches.hints: If the team uses Figma or Drive, call that out to boost relevance

touches.objective: Ask for a short discovery call
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, following up on campaign approvals and creative rework — do you have 15 minutes next week to see three quick ways we help mid-market agencies speed up launches?
touches.hints: Call in early afternoon UK business hours; reference prior touch points

touches.objective: New angle: client-facing briefs and SLAs
touches.subject_line: Turn client briefs into repeatable templates
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, one final note — teams that turn client briefs into reusable Asana templates cut onboarding time for new campaigns and keep SLAs consistent across clients. If you'd like, I can share templates we've used with UK mid-market agencies.
touches.hints: Offer templates as a no-commitment resource; mention typical time savings

sequences.name: US Federal Large Public Sector - Program Leads Outreach Sequence
sequences.persona_name: US Federal Large Public Sector - Program Leads
sequences.objective: Start a conversation about auditable task histories and automating oversight reporting for federal programs

touches.objective: Introduce auditability and centralized decision records pain
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, managing multi-year federal programs typically suffers from siloed decision logs and fragmented task histories — that makes audits and oversight reporting time-consuming. Asana creates permissioned, auditable task histories and centralized decision records so program leads can produce traceable logs quickly and consistently. Could we schedule 20 minutes to discuss how this might reduce audit prep time?
touches.hints: Reference relevant program name or oversight body if publicly known; avoid naming sensitive agencies

touches.objective: Share a public sector reporting automation example
touches.subject_line: Case study: automated roll-up reports for a federal program
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, sharing a brief example — a large federal program we supported automated roll-up reporting in Asana and cut status-assembly time from weeks to days for oversight boards. Happy to DM the summary.
touches.hints: Mention government-friendly compliance features (audit logs, permissions) in follow-up materials

touches.objective: Deep dive on aligning portfolios and reducing schedule slippage
touches.subject_line: Reduce schedule slippage across siloed workstreams
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, schedule slippage often stems from siloed workstreams and missed milestone dependencies. Asana aligns portfolios, enforces milestone cadences and surfaces at-risk work so PMOs catch slippage earlier — one program we worked with improved milestone adherence by 25%. Would you like a short summary of the rollout approach we used?
touches.hints: Offer a redacted summary tailored to federal procurement constraints and security posture

touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, following up on auditability and rolling status reporting — do you have 20 minutes next week for a briefing on how Asana supports auditable logs and automated oversight exports?
touches.hints: Call during federal business hours; mention prior email and LinkedIn note

touches.objective: Offer compliance-focused resources and final nudge
touches.subject_line: Fed-friendly playbook: audits, reports, and milestones
touches.content_suggestion: Hi {{first_name}}, sharing a federal playbook that outlines how we set up permissioned logs, audit trails, and roll-up reporting for large programs. If it’s helpful I can send the redacted playbook and a short checklist your team can use.
touches.hints: Highlight FedRAMP/other compliance context if applicable; offer redacted examples rather than named agencies
